title: abigen: failing to unpack Seaport calldata -- bytes32 interface conversion bug
body:
#### System information

Abigen version: `abigen version 1.11.0-unstable-ec2ec2d0-20221122`
OS & Version: OSX 12.6.1
Commit hash : `ec2ec2d0`

Related to (or at least similar symptoms of) this issue @MariusVanDerWijden solved previously: https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/22219

#### Expected behaviour

Ran abigen on the Seaport 1.1 and got the following struct:
```go
// BasicOrderParameters is an auto generated low-level Go binding around an user-defined struct.
type BasicOrderParameters struct {
	ConsiderationToken                common.Address
	ConsiderationIdentifier           *big.Int
	ConsiderationAmount               *big.Int
	Offerer                           common.Address
	Zone                              common.Address
	OfferToken                        common.Address
	OfferIdentifier                   *big.Int
	OfferAmount                       *big.Int
	BasicOrderType                    uint8
	StartTime                         *big.Int
	EndTime                           *big.Int
	ZoneHash                          [32]byte
	Salt                              *big.Int
	OffererConduitKey                 [32]byte
	FulfillerConduitKey               [32]byte
	TotalOriginalAdditionalRecipients *big.Int
	AdditionalRecipients              []AdditionalRecipient
	Signature                         []byte
}
```

Attempting to unpack some calldata data into one of these structs with the following:

```go
func TestUnpack(t *testing.T) {
	inputHex := ""
	calldata, err := hex.DecodeString(inputHex[2:])
	if err != nil {
		t.Fatalf("Failed to decode calldata hex: %v", err)
	}

	seaportABI, err := seaport.SeaportMetaData.GetAbi()
	if err != nil {
		t.Fatalf("Failed to get ABI: %v", err)
	}
	method, err := seaportABI.MethodById(calldata[:4])
	if err != nil {
		t.Fatalf("Failed to get method by ID: %v", err)
	}
	out, err := method.Inputs.Unpack(calldata[4:])
	if err != nil {
		t.Fatalf("Failed to unpack calldata: %v", err)
	}
	if len(out) != 1 {
		t.Fatalf("Expected 1 unpacked arg, got %d", len(out))
	}
	untyped := out[0]
	t.Log(untyped.(seaport.BasicOrderParameters))
}
```

I would expect it to be able to unpack into the struct that it generated using the abi (certainly possible i'm misusing the tooling here?)


#### Actual behaviour

Instead it panics and fails to convert the interface.

Error included further below, but pretty prints to a struct looking like this -- with `[32]uint8` instead of `[32]byte`:
```go
type UnpackedBasicOrderParameters struct {
	ConsiderationToken                common.Address `json:"considerationToken"`
	ConsiderationIdentifier           *big.Int       `json:"considerationIdentifier"`
	ConsiderationAmount               *big.Int       `json:"considerationAmount"`
	Offerer                           common.Address `json:"offerer"`
	Zone                              common.Address `json:"zone"`
	OfferToken                        common.Address `json:"offerToken"`
	OfferIdentifier                   *big.Int       `json:"offerIdentifier"`
	OfferAmount                       *big.Int       `json:"offerAmount"`
	BasicOrderType                    uint8          `json:"basicOrderType"`
	StartTime                         *big.Int       `json:"startTime"`
	EndTime                           *big.Int       `json:"endTime"`
	ZoneHash                          [32]uint8      `json:"zoneHash"`
	Salt                              *big.Int       `json:"salt"`
	OffererConduitKey                 [32]uint8      `json:"offererConduitKey"`
	FulfillerConduitKey               [32]uint8      `json:"fulfillerConduitKey"`
	TotalOriginalAdditionalRecipients *big.Int       `json:"totalOriginalAdditionalRecipients"`
	AdditionalRecipients              []struct {
		Amount    *big.Int       `json:"amount"`
		Recipient common.Address `json:"recipient"`
	} `json:"additionalRecipients"`
	Signature []uint8 `json:"signature"`
}
```


#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

Generate bindings for [Seaport 1.1](https://etherscan.io/address/0x00000000006c3852cbef3e08e8df289169ede581#code)

Run the above test case or similar


#### Backtrace

````
panic: interface conversion: interface {} is struct { ConsiderationToken common.Address "json:\"considerationToken\""; ConsiderationIdentifier *big.Int "json:\"considerationIdentifier\""; ConsiderationAmount *big.Int "json:\"considerationAmount\""; Offerer common.Address "json:\"offerer\""; Zone common.Address "json:\"zone\""; OfferToken common.Address "json:\"offerToken\""; OfferIdentifier *big.Int "json:\"offerIdentifier\""; OfferAmount *big.Int "json:\"offerAmount\""; BasicOrderType uint8 "json:\"basicOrderType\""; StartTime *big.Int "json:\"startTime\""; EndTime *big.Int "json:\"endTime\""; ZoneHash [32]uint8 "json:\"zoneHash\""; Salt *big.Int "json:\"salt\""; OffererConduitKey [32]uint8 "json:\"offererConduitKey\""; FulfillerConduitKey [32]uint8 "json:\"fulfillerConduitKey\""; TotalOriginalAdditionalRecipients *big.Int "json:\"totalOriginalAdditionalRecipients\""; AdditionalRecipients []struct { Amount *big.Int "json:\"amount\""; Recipient common.Address "json:\"recipient\"" } "json:\"additionalRecipients\""; Signature []uint8 "json:\"signature\"" }, not seaport.BasicOrderParameters
````

thanks in advance for any help/guidance! :)
Seeing similar trying to unpack on the cancel method, so it might not be isolated to just the one

The `[32]uint8` instead of `[32]byte` difference does not matter. The types `uint8` and `byte` are the same. 

Your conversion does not work because the unpacked struct has `json:"..."` struct tags and the struct type you are converting to doesn't. Another difference is the type of the `AdditionalRecipients` field.

It is not possible to unpack and then convert the type in the way you are trying. Please try [UnpackIntoInterface](https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/blob/v1.10.26/accounts/abi/abi.go#L115) [¶](https://pkg.go.dev/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/accounts/abi#ABI.UnpackIntoInterface) with your struct.
